meanings.sent1: The predictabilities of the weather make planning picnics easier.
meanings.sent2: The predictabilities of the stock market help investors make informed decisions.
meanings.sent3: Even though he tried to surprise her, his predictabilities always gave him away.
meanings.sent4: Her predictabilities were like a well-worn path, easy to follow.
meanings.sent5: The predictabilities of his routine were comforting in their familiarity.

meanings.definition: The state of being able to be predicted.
meanings.sent1: The predictabilities of the train schedule allow commuters to plan their day.
meanings.sent2: The predictabilities of the traffic patterns help city planners improve road systems.
meanings.sent3: His predictabilities in always choosing the same restaurant made his friends chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The predictabilities of nature's cycles remind us of the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The predictabilities of her behavior made her a reliable friend.
